summary: Nirvana was an American rock band formed in 1987. The band, led by Kurt Cobain, became famous for their unique sound, blending quiet verses with loud choruses. Their 1991 album *Nevermind* and single "Smells Like Teen Spirit" made them hugely popular, ending the era of hair metal. Nirvana's music and style influenced many other bands. Despite their short time in the spotlight, they won several awards and sold over 75 million records worldwide. They were inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in 2014.
title: Nirvana (band)
